prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText:
Array configuration: Our targets have expected source sizes of order 1-1.5''. As we only aim to measure the total flux of each line in each object we ask for the most compact array configuration, C34-1 or C34-2, in order to keep the phase stability at its maximum.
Correlator setup: The line width of our targets is FWHM=500 km/s. We aim for a velocity resolution of 100 km/s to resolve the line profiles. As such we ask for FDM mode with 1.875GHz bandwidth and x16 frequency binning to keep the data load at a minimum. This typically results in a velocity resolution of 20 km/s. The data will be bined to lower resolution depending on the targets FWHM and signal to noise ratio.

prp:ObsProposal.prp:abstract:
In Cycle 0 we performed an unbiased redshift survey in the 3mm band of 26 1.4mm selected SPT sources. This survey is a large success and yields 44 detected line features, >60% redshifts at z>3 and two sources at z=5.7. The resulting redshift distribution, N(z), is almost flat between z=2.5-4.5, in contrast to experiments based on radio identified SMGs in the past with far reaching consequences for the obscured star formation rate density at high redshift.
It is of now of prime importance to firmly establish and understand the difference in N(z) for SMGs resulting from the different techniques. This, however, requires much larger sample sizes. Observing time for further 15 sources has been granted in Cycle 1, but this will not change the situation significantly. The prime goal of this proposal is to increase the sample size by a factor of ~3 compared to our published redshift distribution (72 sources in total with 31 targets requested here), comparable in size to the largest optical redshift surveys of SMGs. Only these observations will provide the required statistical robustness to firmly establish the shape of the SMG redshift distribution from unbiased mm scans.
prp:ObsProposal.prp:scientificCategoryString: Cosmology and the High Redshift Universe
